title: The Dow Drops 122 Points Because U.S. Manufacturing Is Stuck in a Rut
text:
Stocks are falling because U.S. manufacturing shrank for the second consecutive month. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 122.49 points, or 0.46%, to 26,794.34. The S&P 500 fell 10.20 points, or 0.34%, to 2966.54, and the Nasdaq Composite slipped 12.78, or 0.16%, to 7986.56.

The Institute for Supply Management Purchasing Managers Index, or PMI, came in at 47.8 for September. The PMI is a survey of manufacturing businesses across the country, and the latest figure is the second straight reading below 50, which indicates...
description: The Institute for Supply Management Purchasing Managers Index, or PMI, came in at 47.8 for September. The PMI is a survey of manufacturing businesses across the country, and the latest figure is the second straight reading below 50, which indicates contraction.
